volunteer_experiences.description: I am serving as a mentor in the Cargill Global Scholarship Program. My role is to help the assigned scholars nurture and grow in their academic and professional aspirations to help them positively contribute to their community.

Partners in Food Solutions (PFS) is a nonprofit organization that links the technical and business expertise of volunteer employees from General Mills, Cargill, Royal DSM and Bühler to small and growing food processors and millers in the developing world. The PFS mission is to mobilize corporate volunteers to share knowledge and expertise with small and growing food processors to improve the food value chain in Africa.
I serve as relationships manager with client Lina Millers Company Limited Tanzania which is the maize flour mill managed by a woman entrepreneur Joyce Kimaro. She started milling in the year 2012 using hammer mills with the capacity of 10MT/Day as a sole proprietor. In the year 2017, she registered the company as limited by share having two main shareholders. The company produces unfortified maize flours branded in three brands Lina Sembe, Faraja Dona and Vikindu Sembe packaged in 5, 10 and 25 Kg which is distributed in Dar es Salaam and the nearby regions mostly using company trucks. 
The company has buildings, trucks and human resources to support the operations. It employs 11 full-time employees and 24 temporary staffs. 60% of raw materials are bought at a Manzese market in Dar es Salaam and the rest are brought at the mill by aggregators, individual farmers, and middlemen. 
I am responsible for understanding and communicating the needs of a client, and ensuring success of volunteer project teams in addressing those needs.
